    (ii) an→ℓa_{n} \rightarrow \ellan​→ℓ for some non-zero real number ℓ\ellℓ.

    f(x)=g(b)−g(x)b−x(a⩽x<b),f(b)=g′(b),f(x)=\frac{g(b)-g(x)}{b-x}(a \leqslant x<b), \quad f(b)=g^{\prime}(b), f(x)=b−xg(b)−g(x)​(a⩽x<b),f(b)=g′(b),

    or otherwise, show that there is a subinterval [α,β]⊆[a,b][\alpha, \beta] \subseteq[a, b][α,β]⊆[a,b] such that

    g(β)−g(α)β−α=k\frac{g(\beta)-g(\alpha)}{\beta-\alpha}=k β−αg(β)−g(α)​=k
